title: How many Grammys have Diana Ross won? - Quora

response.answer_text: While I don’t know and this could be Googled: please allow me to correct your grammar and explain the problem. It doesn’t matter how many Grammys: there’s only one Diana Ross. So the verb relates to Ms. Ross and should be singular. Your question should read as follows: “How many Grammys has Diana Ross won?” I’m just guessing here that English is not your first language, and that your native tongue may operate differently than English. My intent is not to single you out, to embarrass you, but to try to teach (I suck at teaching, but I want to help soooo! much!) a simple little thing about the complex conglomeration which is my beloved native tongue. NB: The ‘bible’ of English grammar is a tiny book titled ‘Elements of Style’ by Strunk and White. It can even be found online for free. : ))

Okay, now grammar aside, back to the question. Diana Ross was nominated 11 times, includes as a solo artist, also with the Supremes and one duet with Lionel Ritchie. She never won for her 11 nominations. However, in 2012, she awarded a Lifetime Achievement Award from the Grammy Board, for her body of work! Its easy to get this information on google, just put in your question , and like magic you have it!
